artist: Artist Unknown, late 19th or early 20th century
creditline: Gift of John and Laura Taft
inscription: in LLC in plate: Malaucène | title (?) in LRC in pencil: coup de historial (?)
markings: In LRC in plate: [small symbol] | edition in LLC in pencil: 18/50
provenance: Robert Taft (1889-1953, Cincinnati and Washington, D.C.); by descent to John Taft, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: The mistral is a strong, cold wind that blows through out of the northwest through southeastern France. No one is in sight, and the barely see any windows, suggesting that the Provencal locals are prepared for the harsh weather and are cooped up inside. An inscription tells us that this scene is near Malaucène, a village about 70 miles north of Marseille.
title: Coup de mistral
